title: Adobong Gulay
subtitle: Vegetable adobo
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onions.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add eggplant and carrots, stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Pour soy sauce and vinegar, add bay leaves.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Let sauce reduce slightly before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A vegetarian version of the classic adobo, featuring mixed vegetables braised in the traditional soy sauce and vinegar combination.

title: Adobong Manok
subtitle: Traditional Filipino chicken adobo
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add soy sauce and vinegar, bring to boil.
Add bay leaves and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A traditional Filipino version of the classic adobong manok, featuring authentic flavors and cooking techniques passed down through generations.

title: Asado de Carajay
subtitle: One of the food served during the Liberation of Bulacan Province
ingredients: 4 pcs ginger (chopped and squeeze to get juice)
instructions: Rub onto the chicken a handful of salt and the ginger's juice.
Marinate the chicken for at least 1 hour in soysauce, dayap juice and laurel leaves, then fry a little, set aside.
Saute garlic, white onion and red onion, add the liquid marinade and let it simmer.
Put the chicken unto the mixture, add beer and additional laurel leaves if desired.
Season it with salt and sugar (according to taste).
Cook in slow fire until the chicken is tender and cooked and the sauce thickens.
description: A traditional Bulacan heritage chicken dish served during the Liberation of Bulacan Province, marinated and cooked in a savory sauce.

title: Ensaladang Labanos at Kamatis
subtitle: Traditional Bulacan radish and tomato salad
instructions: Sprinkle salt over julienned radish and let sit for 10 minutes.
Rinse radish and squeeze out excess water.
Arrange radish, tomatoes, and onions in a serving bowl.
Mix calamansi juice, oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Pour dressing over vegetables and toss gently.
Top with sliced hard-boiled egg if desired.
Chill for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve as a refreshing side dish.
description: A refreshing and zesty salad that highlights the crisp texture of fresh radish paired with ripe tomatoes, dressed in a tangy calamansi vinaigrette.

title: Ginisang Gulay
subtitle: Traditional Bulacan mixed vegetable stir-fry
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok.
Sauté garlic, ginger, and onions until aromatic.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add potatoes first and cook for 5 minutes.
Add carrots and cook for another 3 minutes.
Add eggplant, chayote, and radish.
Stir-fry for 8-10 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A healthy and colorful vegetable medley that showcases the fresh produce of Bulacan, perfect as a main dish or side dish.

title: Ginisang Labanos
subtitle: Sautéed radish with pork
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté garlic, onion, ginger, and tomatoes until fragrant and soft.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned and no longer pink.
Add fish sauce and pepper, stir well and let simmer for 2 minutes.
Add sliced radish and mix to combine.
Pour in water, cover, and let it simmer for 5–7 minutes or until radish is tender.
Taste and adjust with salt if needed.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A hearty vegetable dish featuring tender radish sautéed with garlic, tomatoes, and savory pork.

title: Ginisang Sayote
subtitle: Sautéed chayote with eggs
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic, ginger, and onions.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add sliced chayote and stir-fry for 8-10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Push vegetables to one side of the pan.
Pour beaten eggs and scramble.
Mix eggs with vegetables and cook for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A simple and healthy vegetable dish featuring tender chayote sautéed with aromatics and finished with scrambled eggs.

title: Hamon Bulakenya
subtitle: One of the food served during the Liberation of Bulacan Province
instructions: Prick all sides of the meat very well.
Mix sugar, salt and prague powder then wipe it unto the meat.
Place in a covered container and refrigerate it for 3 days.
After 3 days wash the meat and have it boiled in pineapple juice, beer, sugar mixture until tender.
Place the meat in a tray and sprinkle top with extra sugar.
Then pat with hot iron or siense to caramelize the sugar.
Cut into serving pieces.
description: A traditional Bulacan heritage recipe served during the Liberation of Bulacan Province, featuring cured pork with a caramelized sugar coating.

title: Kare-Kare
subtitle: Filipino oxtail stew with peanut sauce
instructions: Boil oxtail and tripe in water for 2 hours until tender.
Reserve the broth and set meat aside.
Sauté garlic and onions in annatto oil.
Add ground peanuts and rice flour, mix well.
Gradually add reserved broth while stirring.
Return meat to the pot and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Season with salt.
Serve hot with bagoong and steamed rice.
description: A rich and creamy Filipino stew featuring oxtail and vegetables in a thick peanut sauce, traditionally served with bagoong.

title: Nilagang Baka
subtitle: Filipino beef soup with vegetables
ingredients: 1 kg beef brisket or short ribs
instructions: Place beef in a large pot with water, bring to a boil.
Add ginger, garlic, and onions.
Simmer for 1.5 hours until beef is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots, cook for 15 minutes.
Add radish and cook for 10 more minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice and calamansi.
description: A hearty Filipino beef soup with tender vegetables in a clear, flavorful broth that's perfect for family meals.

title: Poqui Poqui
subtitle: Traditional Bulacan eggplant and egg dish
instructions: Roast eggplants over open flame until skin is charred and flesh is soft.
Peel off charred skin and mash the eggplant flesh.
Heat oil in pan, sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mashed eggplant and mix well.
Pour beaten eggs and scramble together.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice and calamansi on the side.
description: A beloved Bulacan comfort food that combines roasted eggplant with scrambled eggs, creating a smoky and satisfying dish perfect for any meal.

title: Rellenong Talong
subtitle: Stuffed eggplant
instructions: Grill eggplants until tender but keep shape intact.
Carefully make a slit and scoop out flesh, keeping skin whole.
Heat oil and sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes.
Add eggplant flesh and cook until mushy.
Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble mixture.
Season with salt and pepper, let cool.
Stuff eggplant shells with the mixture.
Dip stuffed eggplants in remaining beaten egg.
Pan-fry until golden brown on all sides.
Serve hot with calamansi and rice.
description: An elegant Bulacan dish where eggplants are hollowed out and stuffed with a savory egg mixture, then fried to perfection.

title: Scrambled Eggs with Tomatoes
subtitle: Simple Filipino-style scrambled eggs
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.
Pour in beaten eggs and let sit for 30 seconds.
Gently scramble eggs with tomato mixture.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook until eggs are set but still creamy.
Serve hot with rice and calamansi.
description: A simple and delicious egg dish that combines the sweetness of tomatoes with fluffy scrambled eggs, perfect for any meal.

title: Sinampalukang Manok
subtitle: Bulacan-style tamarind chicken soup
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot.
Sauté garlic, ginger, onion, and tomatoes.
Add chicken pieces and brown lightly.
Pour water and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Add potatoes and cook for 10 minutes.
Add radish and cook for 5 more minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A comforting and sour soup that's a Bulacan favorite, combining tender chicken with fresh vegetables in a flavorful tamarind-based broth.

title: Sinigang na Hipon
subtitle: Filipino shrimp tamarind soup
instructions: Boil water in a large pot and add tamarind soup mix.
Add tomatoes and onions, simmer for 5 minutes.
Add taro and cook for 10 minutes until tender.
Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes until pink.
Add okra and green chili, cook for 3 minutes.
Add kangkong and cook for 2 minutes until wilted.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A tangy and savory Filipino soup featuring fresh shrimp and vegetables in a flavorful tamarind broth that's both comforting and refreshing.

title: Sisig
subtitle: Sizzling pork sisig
instructions: Boil pork belly until tender, then chop finely.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chopped pork and cook until crispy.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened.
Season with calamansi juice and pepper.
Top with raw egg and mayonnaise before serving.
Serve hot on sizzling plate.
description: A traditional Filipino sizzling pork sisig, featuring crispy pork belly with authentic flavors and cooking techniques passed down through generations.

title: Tinolang Manok
subtitle: Filipino chicken ginger soup
instructions: Heat oil in a pot, sauté ginger, garlic, and onions.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour water and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 25 minutes until chicken is tender.
Add chayote and cook for 10 more minutes.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A comforting Filipino soup featuring chicken and vegetables in a clear, ginger-infused broth that's perfect for cold weather.

title: Tortang Patatas
subtitle: Filipino potato omelet
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, then drain and mash lightly.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic, onions, and tomatoes.
Add mashed potatoes and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper, let cool slightly.
Mix in beaten eggs thoroughly.
Form into patties and pan-fry until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with calamansi and rice.
description: A hearty Filipino omelet made with mashed potatoes and eggs, perfect for breakfast or any meal of the day.

title: Tortang Talong
subtitle: Bulacan-style eggplant omelet
instructions: Grill eggplants until skin is charred and flesh is tender.
Carefully peel off skin, keeping the stem intact.
Gently flatten the eggplant with a fork.
Beat eggs with salt and pepper.
Dip each eggplant in beaten egg mixture.
Pan-fry until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with rice and calamansi dipping sauce.
description: A classic Filipino dish popular in Bulacan, featuring grilled eggplant coated in egg and pan-fried to golden perfection.

title: Ukoy na Labanos
subtitle: Bulacan-style radish fritters
ingredients: Calamansi and soy sauce for dipping
instructions: Mix flour with water to make a batter.
Add beaten eggs, garlic, and onion to batter.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix in julienned radish and carrot.
Heat oil for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of mixture into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with calamansi-soy sauce dipping sauce.
description: A crispy and flavorful fritter dish popular in Bulacan, featuring fresh radish and vegetables bound in a light, crispy batter.
